question:
Consider the following pairs:
  1. Lord Curzon - Ancient Monuments Preservation Act
  2. Lord Ripon - Famine Code
  3. Lord Mayo - Department of Agriculture and Commerce
  4. Lord Lansdowne - Durand Commission
   Which of the above is/are correct?
explanation:
All of the above given pairs are correctly matched
Lord Lansdowne served as Governor General and Viceroy of India from 1888 to 1893.During his tenure, Indo-Afghan border {Durand Line} was demarcated. The Indian Council Act, 1892 was enacted and a system of indirect elections started in India. Lord Mayo established Department of Agriculture and Commerce. Lord Ripon formulated the Famine code in 1883.
